thread.title: It's been a decade since Preston walked off Never Mind The Buzzcocks | Metro News

author: Olivia Waring For Metro.Co.Uk
title: It's been a decade since Preston walked off Never Mind The Buzzcocks | Metro News
text:
‚ÄòCome on, Preston. We‚Äôre having fun!‚Äô Simon called after him. 
‚ÄòI ain‚Äôt,‚Äô was his final response. Preston and Chantelle were by all accounts very much in love (Picture: Getty) 
Team captain Bill Bailey then headed out into the audience to procure a Preston lookalike to take his place, and the face of TV history was changed forever (to a scowling Ordinary Boy‚Äôs). 
Reflecting on why he would have walked off later, Preston told the BBC : ‚ÄòI‚Äôm struggling to think why I would have acted so weird‚Ä¶ [Simon is] funny, charming and likeable, which made it [walking off] all the more embarrassing. Amstell with team captains Phill Jupitus and Bill Bailey (Picture: BBC) 
‚ÄòI wanted the floor to swallow up and eat me, so I did the next best thing and ran away, which is terrible, because I‚Äôm really not the sort of person to walk away from confrontation, I‚Äôm normally the sort of person to talk it out.‚Äô 
Oh well. Boys will be boys. 
Having quit Buzzcocks in 2009, six years before the show officially ended, Simon is now making a film about veganism, with grime star Jme taking a lead role. 
Preston, meanwhile, has faded into the darkest corner of obscurity. 
Surely what the world needs now is an Ordinary Boys comeback? C‚Äômon, where are their two hypothetical fans when you need ‚Äôem? 
Oh, wait‚Ä¶. four new OB gigs are coming to the UK in May! Result! New Ordinary Boys gigs üèµüé∏ pic.twitter.com/I0mwzYBYh2 
No audience walk-outs allowed.
